briefdescription.para: Get the inverse.

parameterdescription.para: J_minv_m Jacobian of the inverse wrt this.

briefdescription.para: Get the SE_2_3 corresponding Lie algebra element in vector form.

parameterdescription.para: J_t_m Jacobian of the tangent wrt to this.

simplesect.para: This is the log() map in vector form.

briefdescription.para: This function is deprecated. Please considere using log instead.

memberdef.name: compose

briefdescription.para: Composition of this and another SE_2_3 element.

parameterdescription.para: J_mc_ma Jacobian of the composition wrt this.
J_mc_mb Jacobian of the composition wrt m.

memberdef.name: act

briefdescription.para: Get the action of the underlying SE(3) element on a 3d point.

simplesect.para: this method by default returns a rigid motion action on 3d points and does not take into account the embedded linear velocity of total SE_2(3) element

parameterdescription.para: J_vout_m The Jacobian of the new object wrt this.
J_vout_v The Jacobian of the new object wrt input object.

briefdescription.para: Get the adjoint matrix of SE_2_3 at this.

Get the isometry object (double direct isometry).
T = | R t v| | 1 | | 1|

memberdef.argsstring: (const Eigen::MatrixBase< _EigenDerived > &v, tl::optional< Eigen::Ref< Eigen::Matrix< Scalar, 3, 9 >>> J_vout_m, tl::optional< Eigen::Ref< Eigen::Matrix< Scalar, 3, 3 >>> J_vout_v) const
memberdef.name: act

briefdescription.para: Access the underlying data by const reference.
Access the underlying data by const reference.
The base class of the SE_2_3 group.

simplesect.para: See Appendix A2 in the paper "The Invariant Extended Kalman filter as a stable observer". However, note that the serialization used in that paper is different from that defined below The paper uses a SE_2_3 definition as, X = |R v p| | 1 | | 1| with a vector space serialization as (w, a, v) Instead, here we define the SE_2_3 to be, X = |R p v| | 1 | | 1| with a vector space serialization as (v, w, a)
